an4.20:4.1: “Mendicants, a meal-allocator who has four qualities is cast down to hell.
an4.20:4.3: They make decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.
an4.20:4.4: A meal-allocator who has these four qualities is cast down to hell.
an4.20:5.1: A meal-allocator who has four qualities is raised up to heaven.
an4.20:5.3: They make decisions unprejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.
an4.20:5.4: A meal-allocator who has these four qualities is raised up to heaven.”
an4.20:6.2: unprincipled, with no respect for principle,
an4.20:6.3: led astray by favoritism, hatred, stupidity, or cowardice,
an4.20:6.4: are called ‘an assembly of the dregs’:
an4.20:7.1: that’s what was said by the ascetic who knows.
an4.20:7.2: And so those good, praiseworthy people,
an4.20:7.3: standing on principle, doing nothing wrong,
an4.20:7.4: not led astray by favoritism, hatred, stupidity, or cowardice,
an4.20:7.5: are called ‘an assembly of the cream’:
an4.20:7.6: that’s what was said by the ascetic who knows.”
